higiene.title: How to maintain good daily oral hygiene
higiene.description: Discover best practices for proper brushing and keeping impeccable oral hygiene every day.
higiene.intro: Oral hygiene is essential to keep teeth and gums healthy throughout life.
higiene.whyTitle: Why is oral hygiene so important?
higiene.whyText: The mouth is the gateway to our body. When we neglect oral hygiene, we allow harmful bacteria to build up.
higiene.pillarsTitle: The pillars of good oral hygiene
higiene.brushingText: Brush at least twice a day with gentle movements.
higiene.flossText: Floss removes food debris and plaque between teeth.
higiene.mouthwashText: Mouthwash helps reduce bacteria and strengthens enamel.
higiene.tipsText: Avoid sugar, drink water, don‚Äôt smoke, and visit the dentist regularly.
higiene.conclusionText: Good oral hygiene ensures a healthy smile for life.
higiene.ctaText: Book an appointment for a complete assessment.
higiene.lead: Small daily habits make a big difference. Here‚Äôs a practical guide to keep teeth and gums healthy ‚Äî at home and between visits.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Need a personalized plan? We can review your routine and recommend the best products and techniques.

takeaways.title: Key takeaways
takeaways.one: Brush 2√ó/day for 2 minutes with a gentle technique and fluoride toothpaste.
takeaways.two: Clean between teeth daily (floss or interdental brushes) ‚Äî many cavities start there.
takeaways.three: Reduce sugar between meals and avoid constant snacking; water is your best ally.

cavities.title: Fewer cavities
cavities.text: Plaque and sugar feed bacteria that weaken enamel.

gums.title: Healthier gums
gums.text: Bleeding isn‚Äôt normal ‚Äî it‚Äôs a sign of inflammation.

breath.title: Fresher breath
breath.text: Cleaning the tongue + interdental areas reduces odor.

1.title: Brush (2 minutes)
1.text: Use a soft brush and fluoride toothpaste. Focus on the gumline and all surfaces.

2.title: Clean between teeth
2.text: Use floss or interdental brushes once a day. It removes plaque where the brush can‚Äôt reach.

3.title: Tongue cleaning
3.text: Gently clean your tongue to reduce bacteria and improve breath.

4.title: Mouthwash (optional)
4.text: Use an alcohol-free mouthwash when recommended. Avoid rinsing right after brushing to keep fluoride on teeth longer.

tech.do1: Use small circular motions with light pressure.
tech.do2: Angle the brush ~45¬∞ toward the gumline.
tech.do3: Replace the brush/head every ~3 months (or sooner if bristles fray).
tech.avoid1: Brushing too hard (can cause gum recession and sensitivity).
tech.avoid2: Ignoring the gumline ‚Äî that‚Äôs where plaque builds up most.
tech.avoid3: Brushing immediately after acidic drinks; wait ~30 minutes.

higiene.flossSectionText: Many cavities and gum issues start between teeth. If floss is difficult, interdental brushes can be a great alternative ‚Äî ask which size is best for you.
higiene.flossHow1: Slide gently between teeth and make a ‚ÄúC‚Äù shape around the tooth.
higiene.flossHow2: Move up and down along both sides of the tooth.
higiene.flossHow3: Use a clean section of floss for each space.

diet.good3: Chew sugar-free gum after meals (if recommended) to stimulate saliva.
diet.limit2: Sipping sodas/juices over long periods (constant acidity).
diet.limit3: Smoking (increases gum disease risk and staining).

higiene.warningSubtitle: If you notice any of these signs, consider booking an evaluation:

warning.1: Gums bleeding when brushing or flossing
warning.5: Pain when chewing or jaw discomfort

faq.q1: If my gums bleed, should I stop flossing?
faq.a1: Usually no. Bleeding is often a sign of inflammation. Floss gently and consistently; if it persists after 1‚Äì2 weeks, get evaluated.
faq.a2: Not always. It can help in specific cases (gingivitis, high cavity risk). The essentials are brushing + interdental cleaning.
faq.q3: Is an electric toothbrush worth it?
faq.a3: For many people, yes ‚Äî it improves consistency and plaque removal. Technique still matters.

finalCta.title: Want a personalized oral hygiene plan?
finalCta.text: We can assess your gums, cavity risk, and recommend products and techniques tailored to your needs.

whatsapp.message: Hello! üòä I found you through the website and I‚Äôd like to speak with the clinic. Can you reply here to help me book and/or get information?

faq.subtitle: We‚Äôve gathered the most common questions from our patients. If you can‚Äôt find the answer you‚Äôre looking for, please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us.

cta.text: Still have questions? We‚Äôre here to help!

hours.q: What are the clinic‚Äôs opening hours?
hours.a: Our clinic is open Monday to Friday from 9am to 7pm, and on Saturdays from 9am to 1pm. We are closed on Sundays and public holidays.

appointment.q: Do I need to book an appointment?
appointment.a: Yes, we always recommend booking in advance to ensure the best service. However, in urgent cases, we will do our best to see you on the same day.

payments.q: What payment methods do you accept?
payments.a: We accept cash, card (Multibanco), MBWay, and bank transfer. We also offer flexible payment options and financing for more extensive treatments.

insurance.q: Does the clinic work with health insurance?
insurance.a: Yes, we work with most health insurance providers and subsystems. Contact us to confirm whether your plan is included in our list of agreements.

routine_duration.q: How long does a routine appointment take?
routine_duration.a: A routine appointment, including a check-up and scaling (cleaning), takes about 45 minutes to 1 hour, depending on each patient‚Äôs needs.

pain.a: We use modern techniques and local anesthesia to ensure maximum comfort during procedures. Most patients do not feel pain during treatment.

kids_first_visit.q: At what age should children start seeing a dentist?
kids_first_visit.a: We recommend the first dental visit around one year of age or when the first teeth appear. Regular visits help prevent future problems.

implant_duration.q: How long does a dental implant last?
implant_duration.a: With proper care, a dental implant can last a lifetime. Good oral hygiene and regular follow-up appointments are essential.

whitening.a: No. When performed by qualified professionals using appropriate products, whitening is safe and does not damage enamel.

booking.q: How can I book an appointment?
booking.a: You can book by phone at 924 123 784, by email at geral@silvioaraujo.com, or through the booking form on our website.
